Savoury Spinach Scones

Carbs donâ€™t kill. ðŸ”ª

oven appetizer baking healthyish quick
vegetarian bread
razvan
under 60mins
brunch

Ingredients for servings

    for the mix

  • 2.5 cup(s) of self raising flour

  • 1 cup(s) mixed grated cheese we used cheddar and mozarella

  • 1 cup(s) baby spinach chopped

  • 1 tbsp onion powder

  • 1 cup(s) almond milk

  • 0.5 tsp salt

  • 0.5 tsp pepper

  • 30 g unsalted butter, melted

    • for the coat

  • 1 tbsp butter, melted

  • 0.25 cup almond milk

  • 0.5 tsp ground coriander

  • 0.5 tsp rosemary

  • pinch of salt and pepper

Directions

  • Preheat your oven to 180Â°C (360Â°F) and line an oven tray with baking parchment.

  • Mix the ingredients for the coat in a cup and set aside.

  • In a bowl combine the grated cheese mix, spinach, onion powder, salt, and pepper.

  • Add in the flour in batches, then mix in the almond milk and add in the melted butter until it all comes together.

  • Knead the formed mix with your hands.

  • Form medium sized spheres in your hands with the mixture.

  • Place your spheres on the tray.

  • Brush each of them on all sides with the coat using a kitchen brush.

  • Bake for 25-30 mins until lightly browned.

Notes

Check if the scones are thoroughly cooked by using a toothpick or a fork.

Goes well with our Veggie Curry Cream Soup.

About

theSkullery.net is all about simplicity, you do not have to log in to see the recipes, your browser is keeping tabs on your favorites, you can dynamically scale your recipes up or down, you can tick off where you are with your instructions, and you can copy all unchecked ingredients to your clipboard for when you go shopping.
I hope you find your inspiration here and cook something as amazing as you.
